p: Comparing the emission from excised leaves and flowers and from crude petroleum extract of plant material, it can be concluded that number of components responsible for scent of plant material (sample A) are more numerous than volatiles emitted from petroleum ether extract (sample D). All 11 components identified in sample D were also present in sample A. Sample A is almost twice more heterogeneous than sample D, where 20 components comprised 96.5% of total identified constituents.
